Uses of Class
world.Sprite

  • Packages that use Sprite 
    Package Description
    bots  
    world  

    • Uses of Sprite in bots

      Methods in bots that return types with arguments of type Sprite 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Sprite> Mind.requestInView()
      Request in view.

    • Uses of Sprite in world

      Subclasses of Sprite in world 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Circle
      The Circle class represents a battle bot sprite in its generic form.
      class  Mine
      The Mine class destroys circles if they touch it.
      class  Obstacle
      The Obstacle class is responsible for rendering immovable and collidable objects in the world.
      class  Projectile
      The projectile class is responsible for managing a projectile a sprite shoots out designed to "kill" other sprites.
      class  Shield
      The Shield class provides a layer of protection for Circles in game.
      Methods in world that return Sprite 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Sprite World.collidingWith(Sprite sprite)
      checks to see if a sprite is colliding with any other sprite in the world.
      Sprite Shield.copy() 
      Sprite Mine.copy() 
      Sprite Circle.copy() 
      Sprite Obstacle.copy() 
      abstract Sprite Sprite.copy()
      The copy method returns a deep copy of the sprite.
      Sprite Projectile.copy() 
      Sprite Shield.getOwner()
      Gets the owner of the shield.
      Sprite World.spawn(World.SpriteType type)
      spawns a new sprite in the world.
      Methods in world that return types with arguments of type Sprite 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Sprite> World.getSprites()
      Gets the sprites in the world.
      java.util.ArrayList<Sprite> Circle.requestInView()
      Requests items in view.
      java.util.ArrayList<Sprite> World.requestInView(Vector2 position, Vector2 face, float fieldOfView)
      Requests all sprites in the object's Field of View.
      Methods in world with parameters of type Sprite 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void World.assignAvailablePosition(Sprite s)
      Assigns an area the sprite will not be colliding with on the world.
      void Sprite.bounce(Sprite s)
      The bounce method rebounds the velocity of this sprite in the x and/or y direction from an obstacle.
      void Shield.collide(Sprite s) 
      void Mine.collide(Sprite s) 
      void Circle.collide(Sprite s) 
      void Obstacle.collide(Sprite s) 
      abstract void Sprite.collide(Sprite s)
      The collide method defines collision behavior for the sprite upon collision with another sprite.
      void Projectile.collide(Sprite s) 
      boolean World.colliding(Sprite A, Sprite B)
      The colliding method checks if 2 sprites are colliding using an Axis-Aligned Bounding-Box.
      Sprite World.collidingWith(Sprite sprite)
      checks to see if a sprite is colliding with any other sprite in the world.
      void Sprite.exchange(Sprite s)
      The exchange method sets the velocity of this sprite to the velocity of a colliding sprite.
      void World.generateObject(Sprite s)
      The generateObeject method adds the input sprite to the world.
      boolean Shield.isOwner(Sprite c)
      The isOwner method tells whether the given circle is the owner of the shield.
      boolean Projectile.isOwner(Sprite c)
      The isOwner method tells whether the given circle is the owner of the projectile.
      void World.respawn(Sprite s)
      respawns a circle in the world in a random location.
      void Shield.setOwner(Sprite owner)
      Sets the owner of the shield.
      void Sprite.slide(Sprite s)
      The slide method sets the position of a colliding object such that its bounding box lies on the edge of the colliding object's bounding box.
      Method parameters in world with type arguments of type Sprite 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void World.setSprites(java.util.ArrayList<Sprite> sprites)
      Sets the sprites in the world.
